title: Pierce Brosnan cradles his granddaughter on family walk | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Pierce Brosnan looked rather the silver fox as he stepped out for a walk in Beverly Hills on Thursday, his sleeves hugging his still toned arms. The 63-year-old ex-Bond was cradling his toddler granddaughter Marley May as he walked alongside her parents: his son Sean Brosnan and Sean's wife Sanja Banic. For his day out in the 90210 zip code, the Drogheda native had paired his dark blue sweater with black trousers and pale grey shoes. Out in Beverly Hills: Pierce Brosnan held his toddler granddaughter Marley May as he took a walk alongside her parents: his son Sean Brosnan and Sean's wife Sanja Banic Meanwhile, his 33-year-old son had popped on a hat the same color as his father's footwear, flinging an open blue shirt over a duller blue T-shirt. Tight fossil grey pants strained against his legs as he strolled alongside his platinum blonde wife, who wore a powder blue top with black leggings. Sean is his father's son by Cassandra Harris, whom the OBE was married to from 1980 until her death of ovarian cancer in 1991. Simply stylish: For his day out in the 90210 zip code, the 63-year-old had paired his dark blue sweater with black trousers Aged only 43 at the time she died, the Sydney-born bombshell had done her turn as a Bond girl in 1981's For Your Eyes Only, in which 007 was played by Roger Moore. The Mrs. Doutfire actor began taking his martinis shaken, not stirred with the 1995 film GoldenEye, six years before marrying his current wife Keely Shaye Smith. His four-film run with the franchise culminated in the 2002 entry Die Another Day, after which Daniel Craig became Bond, beginning with Casino Royale in 2006. Throwback to 1985: Sean is his father's son by Cassandra Harris, whom the OBE was married to from 1980 until her death of ovarian cancer in 1991 Franchise family: Aged only 43 at the time she died, the Sydney-born bombshell had done her turn as a Bond girl in 1981's For Your Eyes Only, in which 007 was played by Roger Moore The Mamma Mia! star and his present wife have got two biological sons, a 20-year-old called Dylan and a 15-year-old called Paris. Cassandra Harris and her first husband Dermot Harris had two children, a now 45-year-old daughter called Charlotte and a now 44-year-old son called Christopher. The Harrises divorced in 1978, and after Dermot died in 1986, Brosnan adopted Charlotte and Christopher, who've both taken his surname.
